page.title: 01LIFE IN SOUTH KILWORTH
page.content: {SOUTH KILWORTH}in the 1980s. The population of{SOUTH KILWORTH}has remained fairly constant, at about 300 souls, for several hundred years, and the old Parish Church still dominates the view as you approach from the West. Most of the tiny cottages have been replaced with larger houses. Most of the inhabitants have the use of a car, and were not born in the village. Few of them are employed there. The village still has its own Primary School, and a Post Office Shop, a Butcher's Shop and a Pub. It also has its own{SOUTH KILWORTH NEWS,} free for every householder. {SOUTH KILWORTH}has its own vineyard which produces English wine.
